Pretty Grim Productions

Remains

Color Grading   Cinematography   

Shot for the Scotland 48 Hour Film Challenge, 'Remains' is a short climate/action film. It was shot on the Saturday and graded on Sunday, as the edit was simultaneously being finalised.

Full short film

Cinematography

The film's cinematography was (mostly) improvised on location, as we had no time to do location scouting beforehand. Additionally, COVID restrictions combined with all-exterior scenes and a very tight schedule meant using no equipment other than a camera, tripod, and shoulder rig.

Color Grading

The main challenge for this project was the time constraint, which forced us to the mercy of Scottish weather and unstable lighting conditions. The grading therefore involved matching sunny early morning shots with overcast afternoon ones, while simultaneously creating a unique, consistent, and quite heavily stylized mood.
